 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָשֶׁה‎</span> **noun [masculine]** ==a vein== (or nerve) in the thigh (etymology dubious; on formative compare [[BDB#Lag|Lag]]<sup>BN 50</sup>; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> apparently ***the portion of the principal vein of the leg which is in the thigh***, vulgar ***sciatic vein***, or (modern) ***sciatic nerve*** and even ***sciatica***, [[BDB#Lane|Lane]]<sup>3033</sup>); — only <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎גִּיד הַנָּשֶׁה‎</span> Gen [[Gen.32.33|Gen 32:33]]a ***the sinew of the thigh-vein*** (or ***thigh-nerve***, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֲשֶׁר עַלכַּֿף הַיָּרֵךְ‎</span>), compare v33b. — On sacredness of thigh, compare [[BDB#RS|RS]]<sup>Sem i. 360; 2nd ed. 380</sup> [[BDB#We|We]]<sup>Heid</sup> (2), 168. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָשִׁים‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אִשָּׁה‎</span> above
